title: Pecos National Historical Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        E.E. Fogelson Visitor Center, Pecos National Historical Park NPS Photo          Even with more than 400 NPS units for you to visit, we think a stop at Pecos NHP (505-757-7241) is well worth your while, from the beautiful setting, to the excellent ruins trail, to the Civil War trail, to the engaging guided tours we offer. Summer Hours From Memorial Day until Labor Day, the park is open from 8:00 to 6:00. Pecos National Historical Park is open every day except for Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's. Winter Hours From Labor Day until Memorial Day, the park is open from 8:30 to 4:00. Pecos National Historical Park is open every day except for Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's.  Fees  Entrance to the park is free, as are the guided tours we offer.  Camping  Although camping is not allowed on the grounds at Pecos National Historical Park, campgrounds are located in the Santa Fe National Forest just north of the park on NM highway 63. For more information about camping and other permits from the Forest Service, contact: Pecos District Ranger Station, Box 429, Pecos, NM 87552 or call (505) 757-6121.  Motorcyle Riding in National Parks          2016 Military Pass - annual pass for active duty military and spouses. The park continues to offer the three free passes: Military, Access, and 4th Grade/Every Kid in a Park. Please call our Visitor Center at 505-757-7241 for information or if you have questions.
